page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content: There are three Anglican Churches in the area, at Hopton Wafers, Doddington and Cleeton St Mary and a Methodist Chapel at Hopton Bank. Hopton Church is the oldest church and was built originally in the thirteenth century. It was rebuilt in eighteen twenty five in the Early English style. Doddington church was built in eighteen forty nine by Thomas Botfield of Hopton Wafers. It was built from Clee Hill stone in the Gothic style. Cleeton church was built and endowed by George Pardoe the land-owner in eighteen seventy eight and is Early English in style. The Methodist Chapel at Hopton Bank was built in eighteen eighty when there were many mining families and a larger brick building was erected when the original one became too small.
